title: Insuring commercial suborbital flights could be tricky, at least initially
summary: MILAN – When commercial suborbital spaceflight companies lose the liability protection they currently enjoy, insurance coverage may initially be quite expensive. That was the conclusion of a paper, by PwC […]

title: EarthCARE synergy reveals power of clouds and aerosols
summary: With the initial images from each of the instruments aboard ESA’s EarthCARE satellite now in hand, it's time to reveal how these four advanced sensors work in synergy to measure exactly how clouds and aerosols influence the heating and cooling of our atmosphere.

title: ESA picks Kepler-led group to develop LEO optical data relay network
summary: The European Space Agency has awarded a group led by Kepler Communications, a Canadian small satellite operator, a 36 million euro ($39 million) contract to develop a low Earth orbit optical relay network.

title: No simple answers for debris mitigation
summary: MILAN – National and international debris mitigation standards and policies are evolving rapidly to keep pace with increasingly complex space operations. With several large constellations poised to take flight and […]

title: Astrolab unveils smaller lunar rover
summary: Venturi Astrolab, a company developing large lunar rovers for roles that include transporting astronauts on Artemis missions, will first fly a smaller rover primarily as a tech demo mission.

title: Inversion secures reentry license for first mission
summary: Inversion, a startup developing systems to return cargo from space to Earth, has received a license for its first mission launching in November.

title: What is a Coral Reef?
summary: Coral reefs cover only 1% of the ocean floor, but support an estimated 25% of all marine life in the ocean, earning them the moniker ‘rainforest of the sea.’ They also play a critical role for coastal communities; preventing coastal erosion, protecting coastlines from hurricane damage, and generating $36 billion in annual income worldwide. We […]

title: Station Science Top News: Oct. 11, 2024
summary: Researchers verified that 3D micro-computed tomography scans can map the orientation of plant roots in space and used the method to demonstrate that carrots grown in actual and simulated microgravity both had random root orientation. These findings suggest that simulated microgravity offers a reliable and more affordable tool for studying plant adaptation to spaceflight. MULTI-TROP evaluated the role of […]

title: China launches second batch of 18 satellites for Thousand Sails megaconstellation
summary: MILAN — China successfully launched the second group of 18 satellites for the planned 14,000-satellite Thousand Sails megaconstellation Tuesday. A Long March 6A rocket lifted off from Taiyuan Satellite Launch […]

title: Army’s space tech roadmap emphasizes secure navigation, satcom, intelligence
summary: Army’s greater focus on space is part of the military’s strategy for "multi-domain operations”
